question.text: 1. Create a CSS class called "highlight" that changes the background color to yellow.
2. Write CSS code to center align text within a div element.
3. Create a CSS class called "underline" that adds an underline to text.
4. Write CSS code to give a 2px solid red border to all paragraph elements.
5. Create a CSS class called "rotate" that rotates an element by 45 degrees.
6. Write CSS code to set the font size of all headings (h1 to h6) to 24px.
question.answer: css h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 { font-size: 24px; }

question.text: 7. Create a CSS class called "opacity" that sets the opacity of an element to 0.5.
8. Write CSS code to give a background image to a div element.
9. Create a CSS class called "uppercase" that converts text to uppercase.
10. Write CSS code to give a box shadow of 2px 2px 5px #888888 to a button element.
11. Create a CSS class called "italic" that sets the font style of text to italic.
12. Write CSS code to set the width of an image to 300px and height to auto.
13. Create a CSS class called "background-gradient" that sets a linear gradient background from red to blue.
14. Write CSS code to give a hover effect to a link, changing its color to red.
15. Create a CSS class called "center-block" that centers a block-level element horizontally using margin.
16. Write CSS code to hide bullets in an unordered list (ul).
17. Create a CSS class called "box-sizing-border" that sets the box-sizing property to border-box.
18. Write CSS code to set the color of visited links to green.
19. Create a CSS class called "text-overflow" that adds an ellipsis (...) to text that overflows its container.
question.answer: css .text-overflow { text-overflow: ellipsis; white-space: nowrap; overflow: hidden; }

question.text: 20. Write CSS code to give a transition effect to an image, changing its opacity over 1 second when hovered over.
